Sudang Lepet.cara: Salted fish is wrapped in banana leaves and grilled with coconut oil
Sudang Lepet.budaya: Represents coastal heritage and traditional preservation methods

Tipat Cantok.cara: Rice cakes and veggies are steamed then mixed with thick peanut sauce
Tipat Cantok.budaya: Common daily snack; reflects simplicity and balance

Serombotan.cara: Steamed vegetables topped with spicy grated coconut sauce
Serombotan.budaya: A healthy vegetarian dish from traditional farming communities

Bubur Mengguh.cara: Porridge cooked thick, topped with seasoned chicken and fried shallots
Bubur Mengguh.budaya: Served during ceremonies and village gatherings

Bir Singaraja.cara: Difermentasi dari malt, hop, ragi, dan air.

Sambal Indofood.cara: Dikonsumsi langsung sebagai pelengkap makanan atau sebagai bahan masakan.
Sambal Indofood.budaya: Digunakan luas dalam hidangan sehari-hari masyarakat Indonesia.

Minyak Kayu Putih.cara: Dioleskan pada kulit untuk meredakan nyeri, gatal, atau menghangatkan tubuh. Dapat juga dihirup aromanya.
Minyak Kayu Putih.budaya: Digunakan secara luas di Indonesia sebagai obat keluarga untuk masuk angin, perut kembung, gatal-gatal, dan gigitan serangga.

Es Daluman.cara: Daluman jelly is cut, poured with coconut milk and palm sugar
Es Daluman.budaya: Refreshing drink, often enjoyed in hot weather

Kopi Kintamani.cara: Brewed or filtered using traditional methods
Kopi Kintamani.budaya: Pride of Bangli highlands, with GI (Geographical Indication) certification

Sate Plecing.cara: Grilled meat served with spicy tomato sambal
Sate Plecing.budaya: Popular in Tabanan, symbolizes fiery and bold flavor

Jaje Laklak.cara: Batter is poured into small mold, cooked and topped with coconut and sugar
Jaje Laklak.budaya: Traditional Balinese cake often served during ceremonies

Jukut Ares.cara: Banana stem cooked with meat and traditional spices
Jukut Ares.budaya: Common in ceremonies as a sustainable and humble dish

Nasi Tepeng.cara: Soft rice served with various spiced side dishes
Nasi Tepeng.budaya: Symbol of cultural identity in breakfast traditions

Loloh Cemcem.cara: Leaves blended and mixed with tamarind and sugar
Loloh Cemcem.budaya: Traditional herbal drink believed to have health benefits

Entil.cara: Rice is steamed in banana leaves and served with side dishes

Rujak Bulung.cara: Seaweed mixed with spicy grated coconut and sambal
Rujak Bulung.budaya: Common coastal snack rich in iodine and culture

Ayam Betutu.cara: Marinated with complete Balinese spices, wrapped in banana leaves, steamed
Ayam Betutu.budaya: Traditional ceremonial dish and symbol of respect

Lawar Merah.cara: Marinated with complete Balinese spices, wrapped in banana leaves, steamed

Aqua.cara: Marinated with complete Balinese spices, wrapped in banana leaves, steamed

Siobak.cara: Pork is roasted, then coated with seasoned sweet soy sauce
Siobak.budaya: Non-halal dish popular among northern Balinese communities
